title: How to Evolve Jigglypuff Into Wigglytuff in Pokemon Scarlet/Violet

steps.title: Obtain a Moon Stone.
steps.content: Obtain a Moon Stone. Many Pokémon evolve with evolutionary stones, but Jigglypuff is the only Pokémon in the Pokemon Scarlet and Violet base game that evolves with a Moon Stone. (Note that if you have the Hidden Treasure of Area Zero DLC, you will be able to find a Clefairy that evolves into a Clefable with a Moon Stone. [1] X Research source ) Moon Stones can be obtained from the Porto Marinada auction, the Asado Desert as sparkling overworld items, or a Pokémon with the ability Pickup. You can also find them as hidden items in South Province Area Three and West Province Area Two. The reward for catching 210 Pokémon in the Paldea Pokédex is a Moon Stone. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use the Moon Stone on your Jigglypuff.
steps.content: Use the Moon Stone on your Jigglypuff. Your Jigglypuff can be any level and you can do this at any time of day. Once you use the Moon Stone, your Jigglypuff will evolve into a Wigglytuff. [3] X Research source Wigglytuff can also be caught in North Province Area One very rarely. You can also find them in 4-star Tera Raid Battles. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Igglybuff evolves into Jigglypuff.
steps.content: Igglybuff evolves into Jigglypuff. Igglybuff can be found in South Province Area One, Area Two, Los Platos, and the Pokémon League. [5] X Research source Igglybuff evolves into Jigglypuff after you raise its friendship and level it up. [6] X Research source If you're simply looking to fill out your Paldea Pokédex, catching a separate Igglybuff and Jigglypuff would be quicker and more efficient.

steps.title: Jigglypuff can be caught in a few places around Paldea.
steps.content: Jigglypuff can be caught in a few places around Paldea. You can catch Jigglypuff in South Province Area Two, West Province Area Three, and South Province Area Three as a Water Tera Type. [7] X Research source
